title: Drawing, "Cancer, Lunette for Ceiling, Sala Ottagonale, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and light brown wash over graphite on white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, upper center: Cancro 1 - l'estate; in graphite: squared off at sides 1-4 and at top and bottom 1-8 with light source symbol at upper left
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Flying winged putto carrying disk, or platter, and crab.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Cancer, Lunette for Ceiling, Sala Ottagonale, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05.
1804–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and light brown wash over graphite on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1191.
